title: Upgrade smallvec 0.6 -> 1.1
body:
Good to use stable & latest release of smallvec.

Though this required minimum Rust version to be bumped to 1.36.

title: Update dependencies
body:
Update `curl-sys` and `voribs` for the `cmp` crate.

The `sample-rate-max.ogg` test fails on `Windows` because the `vorbis` crate reads it as a `badHeader`, so it's not a `lewton` problem. Unfortunately, the `vorbis` crate can't be further updated.

title: Add macOS to CI
body:
This PR adds `macOS` to the `Github Actions`.

Even for this system, I had to disable some tests in order to run the job without errors.

Unfortunately, I wasn't able to run the tests for the `1.20` version because the `cc` library is too old.

Thanks in advance for your review! :)

title: Remove travis
body: Since `lewton` is using the `Github Actions` now

title: Avoid allocating a vector in loop in `read_audio_packet_generic`
Fix examples for no-default-features
body:
Fixed tests for the `--no-default-features` option

Thanks in advance for your review! :)

title: Fix tests for all-features
body:
Fixed tests for the `--all-features` option

Thanks in advance for your review! :)

title: Add Github Actions
body:
GitHub Actions allow to set `CI` directly into `GitHub`. This PR represents an alternative method to `travis`, but if you want to remove it completely, I can do it using this PR, no problem from my part.

Advantages
- Less time than `travis` (5 minutes instead of 9)
- Avoid using an external dependency

I've tried to replace all `cargo build` commands with the `cargo test` ones, but I got some building errors.  
Since `cargo` builds the crates before testing them, these replacements would decrease the number of steps maintaining the same results.
Do you want me to replace all of them in order to see the errors? Or do you prefer the current way?

Thanks in advance for your review! :)

title: Document how to build and install the C-API
Simplify `extr_neighbor`
body: This PR also changes the interface of function, but it should be fine since it is not public and it is used only trough `low_neighbor` and `high_neighbor`. New implementation passes all the tests in this module.

title: Reduce memory usage in `dct_iv_slow` and `inverse_mdct_slow`
body: There is no sense in allocating a Vec and then immediately cloning it. Also make `mcos` to be big just enough to hold all the precalculated values.

title: Simplify `floor_zero_decode`
body: Since `else` branch is so much shorter it makes sense to return early on `else` condition

title: Add a cbindgen.toml
body:
- Produce a C header instead of C++
- Report the license in the file

title: Capi using cargo c
body:
To address https://github.com/RustAudio/lewton/issues/37 using [cargo-c](https://github.com/lu-zero/cargo-c) to make the process as transparent as possible (short of making a separate crate).

To test install [cargo-c](https://github.com/lu-zero/cargo-c) and run `cargo c install --destdir=/tmp/lewton-test/ to inspect its output.

[header](https://gist.github.com/lu-zero/f56acd4be0369a4331f531f9f1961bcd)
[pkg-config file](https://gist.github.com/lu-zero/01ad2739712dd25e34757523923dc544)

title: Remove the Error::cause
body: It is deprecated since 1.33.0 and it has a default impl.

title: Address issue #44
body: This is my first open source PR, so please keep any criticism constructive, thanks!

title: CFFI Groundwork
body: Groundwork for enabling cbindgen generated bindings.

title: Add some badges to the readme
Performance improvements
body:
Hello, I had some fun profiling this crate with [`perf`](https://perf.wiki.kernel.org/index.php/Main_Page) and trying to fix most performance issues I've found. 

## Summary of changes

- Fixed some low-hanging fruit related to memory allocations: I've added `SmallVec` as a dependency, since some vectors of `bool` were allocated on the heap, in a tight loop, and it was killing performance.

- Lots of explicit loops were replaced with iterators. That's where most of the optimizations come from.
There's plenty of room for improvement here, but most loops were straightforward.

- The `f32` to `i16` conversion code has been thrown away. Just using `as i16` is enough, Rust does the right thing.

- Minor refactorings here and there, e.g. replacing `return something` with just `something` if it's the last thing in the block.

## Results

I'm already seeing some ~10% improvements in my testing. Will benchmark more as I optimize more code.

This pull request is WIP since I am still looking into more potential optimizations. Also need to test more, to ensure I didn't accidentally create any bugs.
